Title: Object: Papyrus Anastasi 2
Description: Papyrus: Hieratic literary text recto and verso. Late Egyptian Miscellanies. Recto: cols 3-6: 2.5-3.6 "Praise of Ramses II as a warrior", 3.6-4.4 "Praise of Merenptah", 4.4-5.4 "More Praise of Merenptah". 5.5-6 "Description of the Castle of Sese", 5.6-6.4 "A letter of adulation to Pharaoh". verso: 8.5-8.7 "Prayer of a defendant to Amun" 8.5-8.7 "Prayer of a defendant to Amun". Verso: Jottings including a couplet of a love song.
Curator's comments: Published in Gardiner Late Egyptian Miscellanies, Caminos Late Egyptian Miscellanies. Spalinger 'Encomia and Papyrus Anastasi II' in Quirke (ed.), Discovering Egypt from the Neva (Fs. Berlev), 123-44. Theodorides, RdE 21, p. 97 [8/7-9/1]
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380656) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380656)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss, fractured, insect attack Black ink Red ink Backed: white paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair
Associated titles: Associated Title: Letter of Adulation to Pharaoh
Associated Title: Profession of a Scribe is superior
Associated Title: Prayer of a Defendant to Amun
